line.comment: * ZH 2.0 - unlock stage 3 immediately so player can buy every ship class from the start
* Herobetty 5.4: no longer needed. See Mayhem.GetYakiStage.xml.
* if not get global variable: name='ZH_AddedYakiFinancing'
* set global variable: name='mayhem_yakiFinancing' value=1000000
* set global variable: name='ZH_AddedYakiFinancing' value=[TRUE]
* end
* ZH 2.0 - halved all costs
* Add-Ons 1.3: Insane increases TS/TP costs by 10x.
* DO NOT USE ARRAYS AS RETURN VALUES. USE TABLES INSTEAD.
* NOTE: [DATATYPE_TABLE] is not recognized by X-Studio. Use "if table get size: table = $return" instead.
* Herobetty 5.4: Black market rework.

* 1. Do not use the player's origin race. Instead, spawn in an unknown sector if there are 3 or more (excluding renegade sector). If there are no sectors left, spawn in a random sector except Xenon sectors, player's current sector, and renegade sector.

* 2. Ship shall be spawned from a predetermined array, randomly generated upon gamestart (to prevent savescumming). There can be a maximum of 100 M3, 200 M4, 400 M5, 14 M6, 4 M7, 40 M8, 32 TM, 115 TS, 160 TP.
* 3. Ship shall spawn in with anywhere between 40% to 70% hull.
* 4. There shall be a 4/3/2 + 0.5 hour timer on easy/normal/hard difficulty to claim the ship without any competition. After that, anyone can claim the ship.
* Step 1: Do not use the player's origin race.
* Any unknown sectors? If there are more than 2 currently connected to the main galaxy (renegade sector does not count until its gate connection is restored), check if it's unknown.
* Otherwise, spawn in a random sector except Xenon sectors, player's current sector, and renegade sector.
* We got a valid sector.
* We got a valid sector.
* Herobetty 5.4 - Step 2: The ship types are now randomly determined at the start of the game. In Mayhem.CreateRandomShip.xml, access those ship arrays instead of creating a brand-new random ship.
* Herobetty 5.4: no longer reveals sector and ship location to the player, as revealing the sector location could become an exploit for discovering what unknown sectors to settle in.
* $ship.sector-> set known status to [TRUE]
* $ship-> set known status to [TRUE]
* Herobetty 5.4 - Step 3: Ship spawns with 40% to 70% hull.
* Herobetty 5.4 - Step 4a: The player has a grace period of 4/3/2 +/- 0.5 hours on easy, normal, and hard mode respectively to claim the ship before anyone can take it.
* Add-Ons 1.2: Added insane mode case in preparation for 1.3. base time in insane is 1 hour.
* DEBUG only: set to 300, then back to original time of 1800/5400/9000/12600 on insane/hard/normal/easy
* Add-Ons 1.2: the timer is now scaled based on the number of sectors in the galaxy, with 100 (small galaxy) being the base number of sectors.
* Herobetty 5.4 - Step 4b: Append the ship to the array of black market ships. This array will be used to keep track of when it's claimable or not.
* Also updated the mission description to display the time the coordinates were bought and the amount of time the player has before NPCs can claim the ship.
* ** DEBUG **

* $t = 'Base Grace Period: ' + $time.baseGracePeriod + '; offset: ' + $time.offset + '; Grace period: ' + $time.gracePeriod + '; hours: ' + $time.hours + '; fractional hours: ' + $time.fractionalHours
* write to player logbook $t

line.text: ', я купил координаты корабля на чёрном рынке. Мне нужно отправиться в сектор '
' ч. прежде чем корабль достанется кому-то другому.'

' ч. прежде чем корабль достанется кому-то другому.'

line.comment: * ZH 2.0 buying an M7 adds 1 infamy
* Activate Yakis if they are fully financed.

line.text: 'Необходимо 5 очков дурной славы (убейте несколько нейтральных торговцев)'
'Они следуют только за настоящим лидером (завершите свое вознесение)'

line.comment: * $t = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.InfoText' : text='Stage 1: M4, M5 - No corruption.'
* add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t
* $t = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.InfoText' : text='Stage 2: M3, TP, TS - Low corruption.'
* add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t
* $t = [NULL]-> call script 'Joubarbe.Lib.InfoText' : text='Stage 3: M6, M7, M8, TM - High corruption.'
* add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t
* Herobetty 5.4: updated info text.
* Add-Ons 1.2: Number of hours to display in minutes so that it can be scaled by galaxy size.
* Add-Ons 1.3: Insane mode.
* Hard
* Normal
* Easy
* Add-Ons 1.2: Updated average time to scale based on galaxy size.

line.text: 'Если не заявить права на корабль вовремя, другие фракции могут его захватить.'

line.comment: * Infoline. Bound to Mayhem.GetYakiStage.
* $t = 'Yaki current stage: ' + $yakiStage + ' / 3'
* Herobetty 5.4: fixed a bug displaying 10M credits. Since ZH 2.0, stage 3 is completed at 4M rather than 10M.

ZH 2.0 - unlock stage 3 immediately so player can buy every ship class from the start
Herobetty 5.4: no longer needed. See Mayhem.GetYakiStage.xml.
if not get global variable: name='ZH_AddedYakiFinancing'
set global variable: name='mayhem_yakiFinancing' value=1000000
set global variable: name='ZH_AddedYakiFinancing' value=[TRUE]
ZH 2.0 - halved all costs
Add-Ons 1.3: Insane increases TS/TP costs by 10x.
DO NOT USE ARRAYS AS RETURN VALUES. USE TABLES INSTEAD.
NOTE: [DATATYPE_TABLE] is not recognized by X-Studio. Use "if table get size: table = $return" instead.
Herobetty 5.4: Black market rework.

1. Do not use the player's origin race. Instead, spawn in an unknown sector if there are 3 or more (excluding renegade sector). If there are no sectors left, spawn in a random sector except Xenon sectors, player's current sector, and renegade sector.

2. Ship shall be spawned from a predetermined array, randomly generated upon gamestart (to prevent savescumming). There can be a maximum of 100 M3, 200 M4, 400 M5, 14 M6, 4 M7, 40 M8, 32 TM, 115 TS, 160 TP.
3. Ship shall spawn in with anywhere between 40% to 70% hull.
4. There shall be a 4/3/2 + 0.5 hour timer on easy/normal/hard difficulty to claim the ship without any competition. After that, anyone can claim the ship.
Step 1: Do not use the player's origin race.
Any unknown sectors? If there are more than 2 currently connected to the main galaxy (renegade sector does not count until its gate connection is restored), check if it's unknown.
Otherwise, spawn in a random sector except Xenon sectors, player's current sector, and renegade sector.
We got a valid sector.
We got a valid sector.
Herobetty 5.4 - Step 2: The ship types are now randomly determined at the start of the game. In Mayhem.CreateRandomShip.xml, access those ship arrays instead of creating a brand-new random ship.
Herobetty 5.4: no longer reveals sector and ship location to the player, as revealing the sector location could become an exploit for discovering what unknown sectors to settle in.
$ship.sector-> set known status to [TRUE]
$ship-> set known status to [TRUE]
Herobetty 5.4 - Step 3: Ship spawns with 40% to 70% hull.
Herobetty 5.4 - Step 4a: The player has a grace period of 4/3/2 +/- 0.5 hours on easy, normal, and hard mode respectively to claim the ship before anyone can take it.
Add-Ons 1.2: Added insane mode case in preparation for 1.3. base time in insane is 1 hour.
DEBUG only: set to 300, then back to original time of 1800/5400/9000/12600 on insane/hard/normal/easy
Add-Ons 1.2: the timer is now scaled based on the number of sectors in the galaxy, with 100 (small galaxy) being the base number of sectors.
Herobetty 5.4 - Step 4b: Append the ship to the array of black market ships. This array will be used to keep track of when it's claimable or not.
Also updated the mission description to display the time the coordinates were bought and the amount of time the player has before NPCs can claim the ship.

write to player logbook $t

add non selectable menu item: $menu, text=$t

Add-Ons 1.2: Number of hours to display in minutes so that it can be scaled by galaxy size.
